comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Perhaps the Caron mentioned in NYT of July 5, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9902E5DA153FE233A... as "the young man who started the free speech agitation at Tarrytown." The article is about the aftermath of his death when a bomb he was handling exploded (on July 4). The bomb was apparently intended to be used against John D. Rockefeller. NYT of June 25, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C0DE6D91F39E633A... suggests his first name was Arthur,

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: More on the bomb accident is at en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louise_Berger#Tarrytown_and_the_Lex...

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Swanq: thank you for identifying IWW member Arthur Caron, who is shown in this image. Another Bain image of the “IWW Committee” also includes him: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5285330161/ Some other images relating to Caron can be found in the Prints and Photographs Online Catalog: NY house wrecked by bomb: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/ggb2005016487/ Caron funeral: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/ggb2005016556/ We will include some of this information when we update the database.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lexington_Avenue_bombing I started an entry for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Caron
